post.description:
This operation allows integrated systems to create a new service request in Oracle Field Service Cloud.

A service request is a data container, which can be used to collect information about activities, resources, or inventories when used by integrated systems. You can also specify service request custom properties while creating a service request. After a service request is created in Oracle Field Service Cloud, it cannot be modified. An existing entity ID (resourceId, activityId, or inventoryId) must be provided with the request. Only one entity ID can be specified in the request, but Oracle Field Service Cloud will populate related IDs (if any).

  • If no entity ID is provided, then a bad request error, 'Required property not set. One of the property: activityId or inventoryId or resourceId must be specified' is returned.

  • If more than one entity ID is provided in the request, then a bad request error, 'Only one of the parameters activityId, inventoryId, resourceId can be specified at one request' is returned.

A new event, resourceRequestCreated, inventoryRequestCreated, customerRequestCreated in Events API is generated depending on the specified entity field (resourceId, inventoryId, activityId) in the request. For example, when an inventory ID is specified when creating a service request, Oracle Field Service Cloud finds the activity or resource that is linked with the specified inventory ID and adds the activityId and resourceId to the service request.

The response of POST or GET methods will return the saved entity IDs. The response also contains the date and time when the service request is created in Oracle Field Service Cloud and is returned in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM format (UTC time zone).

Permissions: The user must at least have read-write access to the service request entity of the Core API; else, the function will return a 403 error.

This operation retrieves the list of users that are visible to the user sending the request.

The visibility rules are based on the user's association with the resource. If the user is assigned to the top level of the resource tree, then all the resources are visible and returned in the response. If the user is assigned to a lower level resource in the resource tree, then only the resources below the lower level resource are returned in the response.

get.description:
This operation retrieves the available booking options (such as buckets and time slots) for booking an activity.

Overview

This operation retrieves the time slots in which the activity can be performed. The following points are considered while booking an activity within the time slots:

  • The booking quota is available for the category and for the day.
  • The booking is not closed for the category, time frame, and work zone.
  • The workforce is available to perform the activity.

Additionally, the StopBookingAt constraint is considered for activity booking in an availability-based quota bucket. The StopBookingAt value denotes the percentage of the quota used for a day and indicates that no more activities can be booked for the selected category, when the StopBookingAt percentage is reached.

Activity fields

This operation calculates the estimated travel time, duration, area, and capacity category for booking an activity based on the activity fields and custom properties request parameters. The built-in activity fields have the same names and the same format as in the other REST API operations. The following built-in fields are considered:

  • apptNumber
  • recordType
  • customerName
  • customerNumber
  • customerPhone
  • customerEmail
  • customerCell
  • streetAddress
  • city
  • postalCode
  • stateProvince
  • reminderTime
  • longitude
  • latitude
  • slaWindowStart
  • slaWindowEnd
  • points
  • timeOfBooking
  • language
  • timeZone
The custom properties are identified by their label and are same as in the other REST API operations.

Activity field requirements are as follows:

  • The 'work zone key' fields must be passed, if the 'determineAreaByWorkZone' parameter is not set to 'false' or if the bucket settings close bookings by work zone.
  • All fields mentioned in work skill conditions should be passed, if the 'determineCategory' parameter is set to 'true', else the category will not be determined.
  • The 'duration key' fields need to be passed, if the 'estimateDuration' parameter is set to 'true'.
  • The 'travel key' fields need to be passed, if the 'estimateTravelTime' parameter is set to 'true'.

For example: If the postal code/Zip code is configured as part of the travel key, then the ?postalCode=12345 must be specified as one of the query parameters.

Note:If any custom property label conflicts with another query parameter, then it will be ignored and cannot be used until renamed.

parameters.name: dates
parameters.description: The dates for which the booking options are requested. The dates are specified as a comma-separated list, for example, YYYY-MM-D1,YYYY-MM-D2,YYYY-MM-D3.

parameters.name: activityType
parameters.description:
The type of the activity. Based on the activity type, predefined company-specific rules are applied while processing an activity. Predefined company-specific rules cover the following:
  • The resources to which the activities can be assigned.
  • The activity processing details.
  • The interaction of the activity with different modules of Oracle Field Service Cloud.

parameters.name: apptNumber
parameters.description: The parameter may be used by integrations to store the identifier of the activity in the origin system. This field has no business significance in Oracle Field Service Cloud and may be left empty.

parameters.name: recordType
parameters.description:
The type of the activity record. The following values are available:
  • regular: The default value for most new activities.
  • prework: The pre-work activity is created in Oracle Field Service Cloud, if the technician needs to perform some work before the actual activity.
  • reopened: The activity is created when an activity in a final status is reopened for some reason.
  • multiday_activity: The activity is created when the 'activityType' specified in the API indicates that it is a segmentable activity.
  • multiday_activity_segment: The activities that are automatically created for segmentable activities, based on their duration and timeslot settings.

parameters.name: customerName
parameters.description: The name of the customer.

parameters.name: customerNumber
parameters.description: The account number of the customer. This parameter is used by integrations as a placeholder for the external identifier of the account ID in the application. This parameter has no business significance in Oracle Field Service Cloud and can be left empty.

parameters.name: customerPhone
parameters.description: The regular (land) phone number of the customer. From version 17.2.1, the phone number is saved in OFSC with the '+' symbol. For example, if you enter the phone number as +1(234)234-23_42, it is saved in OFSC as +12342342342.

parameters.name: customerEmail
parameters.description: The email address of the customer.

parameters.name: customerCell
parameters.description: The customer's cell phone number. From version 17.2.1, the phone number is saved in OFSC with the '+' symbol. For example, if you enter the phone number as +1(234)234-23_42, it is saved in OFSC as +12342342342.

parameters.name: streetAddress
parameters.description: The street address of the customer. This field is used for geocoding and must contain a valid address.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The city of the customer where the activity is scheduled. This field is used for geocoding and must contain a valid address.

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: The postal code of the customer. This field is used for geocoding and must contain a valid address.

parameters.name: stateProvince
parameters.description: The state or province of the customer. This field is used for geocoding and must contain a valid address.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: The longitude coordinate (in degrees) of the activity.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: The latitude coordinate (in degrees) of the activity.

parameters.name: slaWindowStart
parameters.description: The time when the Service Level Agreement (SLA) window starts. Specify the time in 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' format.

parameters.name: slaWindowEnd
parameters.description: The time when the Service Level Agreement (SLA) window ends. Specify the time in 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' format.

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: The cost of the activity in 'points'. This parameter is intended for use by the Routing module.

parameters.name: timeOfBooking
parameters.description: The time when the customer booked the activity. The time is displayed in the time zone of the customer.

parameters.name: reminderTime
parameters.description: The number of minutes before the activity start time the customer must be notified of the activity.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The preferred language of the customer. This parameter is optional and its value defaults to the language set for the Login screen. The accepted language codes are listed on: Supported Language Codes.

parameters.name: languageISO
parameters.description: The ISO language code (for example, 'en-US').

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: The name of the customer's time zone.

parameters.name: determineAreaByWorkZone
parameters.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then the work zone is determined automatically and all capacity areas or groups that have the work zone are processed.

Note: The determination algorithm is based on the calculation of the work zone key (defined in the Company Settings, Work Zone Dictionary screen) and uses the specified activity fields and finds a zone that corresponds to the calculated value. Therefore, all the fields that are used to calculate the work zone key formula are mandatory.

If false, then the capacity area or group is not determined by the work zone of the activity. The default value is true.

parameters.name: areas
parameters.description:
The labels of the capacity areas.

Note: If the 'areas' parameter is not passed and if the 'determineAreaByWorkZone' parameter is set to 'false', then the operation processes all the visible capacity areas.

parameters.name: determineCategory
parameters.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then all the included fields in the work skill conditions must be specified and these fields are required to determine work skills and capacity categories for booking the activity.

Note: Contrary to the 'get_capacity' operation, this operation books activities that do not have capacity categories. Therefore, if the operation is unable to determine a capacity category using the specified fields, it does not return an error.

If false, then the capacity categories are not determined based on the specified activity fields. The default value is true.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: The labels of the capacity categories in the capacity category filter.

parameters.name: estimateDuration
parameters.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true and if the 'Define duration manually' option is disabled for a corresponding activity type, then the operation tries to estimate the duration of the activity using statistics.

To estimate the activity duration, it is required to calculate the activity duration key. Therefore, all the fields that are used to calculate the activity duration key formula become mandatory.

If the 'estimateDuration' option is enabled and the operation is unable to find a corresponding statistical record, then the following values are used:
  • The 'defaultDuration' parameter
    • OR
  • The default duration value defined on the activity type level.

If false, then the operation does not estimate the duration of the activity using statistics. The default value is true.

parameters.name: defaultDuration
parameters.description:
The duration value (in minutes) used in one of the following scenarios:
  • The 'Define duration manually' option is enabled for the activity type.
  • The 'estimateDuration' option is disabled.
  • The statistical record is not available for the activity.

Note:If the 'estimateDuration' option is disabled and if the 'defaultDuration' value is not passed, then the duration of the activity to be booked is the default duration of the activity type.

parameters.name: estimateTravelTime
parameters.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true and the 'Calculate travel' option is set for a corresponding activity type, then the operation tries to estimate the activity travel time using statistics.

To estimate the activity travel time, it is required to calculate the activity travel key. Therefore, all the fields used to calculate the activity travel key formula become mandatory.

Note: The operation uses the same travel estimation algorithm for the activity located in the capacity area.

If false, then the operation does not estimate the activity travel time using statistics. The default value is true.

parameters.name: minTimeBeforeArrival
parameters.description: The parameter is used for day-0 bookings. When it is specified, the operation only returns the intervals where the start time is greater than the sum of currentTime and minTimeBeforeArrival parameters.

parameters.name: includePartiallyDefinedCategories
parameters.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true and if more than one capacity category matching the activity is defined for the capacity areas, then the operation returns capacity areas having at least one capacity category matching the activity.

If false or not specified, then the operation returns only those capacity areas that have all the capacity categories matching the activity. The default value is false.

get.description: This operation returns the maximum available capacity and the estimated availability for each capacity area according to the working calendars.

parameters.description: The dates for which the available capacity is calculated. The date is specified in YYYY-MM-DD format.
parameters.name: dates

parameters.description: The labels of the capacity areas or the capacity area groups.
parameters.name: areas

parameters.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true and if multiple capacity areas are selected, then the max capacity values for each area are aggregated and returned as a single structure. If false, then the max capacity values for each area  are returned separately. The default value is false.
parameters.name: aggregateResults

parameters.description:
The comma-separated  list of time intervals for which the calendar capacity is calculated. Each item in the list represents a particular interval. Use the following format to specify the comma-separated  list of time intervals:
                                           all | <hour>[:<minute>] | [<from hour>[:<from minute>]]-[[<to hour>[:<to minute>]] 
                                           'all' represents a whole working day.
                                            Valid values for hours: [0 to 48] 
                                            The dash sign after 24, for example, 24 - represents overnight work.
                                            Minutes are optional. Valid values for minutes: [0 to 59].
A single time value specified as the interval determines the number of resources available on a given moment.                                         Separate intervals can be specified for the 'calendar' and 'available' capacity. 
                                            The system allows intersected (for example, 9-10, 9.30-12) and duplicated intervals (for example, 12-12:30, 12:30-13) within the same request. 
The default value is all.
parameters.name: calendarTimeIntervals

parameters.description:
The list of time intervals for which the available capacity is calculated. Use the following format to specify the time intervals: 
                                            all | <hour>[:<minute>] | [<from hour>[:<from minute>]]-[[<to hour>[:<to minute>]]. The default value is all.
parameters.name: availableTimeIntervals

get.description:
This operation retrieves a collection of activity duration statistics. The maximum number of records that can be retrieved in a single response is 10000. If there are more than 10000 records, the remaining records can be accessed using the 'next' link available at the bottom of the response.

The error message 'Invalid Resource ID provided in request' is displayed for the HTTP Code 400 response on this operation.

This operation can be used only when the following conditions are satisfied:

  • The customer must have a subscription to Oracle Field Service Professional or Enterprise Cloud Service.
  • The required application must have permission to access the Statistics API. To grant the permission, navigate to Configuration > Applications screen. For the required application, in the API access section, click Add new and select Statistics API.

parameters.description: The external identifier of the resource. To fetch the activity duration statistics at the company level, provide '' (single quotes) as the value for this parameter.
parameters.name: resourceId

parameters.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the details of child resources are included in the response. If false, then the details of child resources are not included in the response. The default value is 'true'.
parameters.name: includeChildren

parameters.description: The value of the activity duration key. It appears as 'Appointment Key' in the report.
parameters.name: akey

200.description: This section describes the 200 status response for this operation. The response contains the collection of activity duration statistics. If neither the 'resourceId' nor the 'akey' is specified as a parameter, the system returns the records for all the applicable values.

default.description: This section describes the default error response for this operation.

patch.description:
This operation updates the activity duration override for the activity duration key that is currently active.

It is possible to override the activity duration either at the company level or at the technician level. To override the activity duration at the company level, the 'resourceId' field must be empty.

If there are multiple activity duration keys configured in the system, the overrides are applicable only to the activity duration key that is currently active. If the activity duration key is modified, then the overrides for that key are deleted from the system. However, the overrides persist if another activity duration key is active, with the old key in the system being inactive state. If the inactive key is set to active again, the overrides that were set corresponding to that key become applicable for the duration estimates.

For the activity duration key that is currently active, the override value is stored in the system along with the statistically learned value. For activity duration estimates, if an override is specified, then the override value is used instead of the statistically learned value. However, the statistically learned value is updated based on the new durations reported. At any point of time, it is possible to stop using the overrides by importing the data again with value 0 in the 'override' field. In such cases, the system starts using the statistically learned value for the duration estimates.

Note:

  • When the Statistics API is used to make activity duration changes, the changes are reflected for all future activities in the application only after the next run of the statistics agent. The statistics agent is run once a day, usually in the early morning hours.
  • The limit for each API request is 10000 records. To update more records, multiple requests can be used.

    • The following error messages are supported for the HTTP Code 400 response on this operation:

    • Maximum number of resource data exceeded. Limit 10000
    • Invalid structure. Items tag missing
    • Invalid structure. Additional tags found under data
    • Invalid structure. <resourceId|akey|override> tag missing
    • Property <resourceId|akey|override> value not set
    • Non numeric property value. Property: override
    • Negative property value not allowed. Property: override
    • Property value should be less than 1440
    • Property akey value length should not exceed 50

    The operation can be used only when the following conditions are satisfied:

    • The customer must have a subscription to Oracle Field Service Professional or Enterprise Cloud Service.
    • The required application must have permission to access the Statistics API. To grant the permission, navigate to Configuration, Applications screen. For the required application, click Add new in the API access section, and select Statistics API.

get.description:
This operation retrieves a collection of activity travel statistics at the company level. The maximum number of records that can be retrieved in a single response is 10000. If there are more than 10000 records, the remaining records can be accessed using the 'next' link available at the bottom of the response.

This operation can be used only when the following conditions are satisfied:

  • The customer must have a subscription to Oracle Field Service Professional or Enterprise Cloud Service.
  • The required application must have permission to access the Statistics API. To grant the permission, navigate to Configuration > Applications screen. For the required application, in the API access section, click Add new and select Statistics API.

parameters.description: The label for the region. For example, 'xyz_enterprise'.
parameters.name: region

parameters.description: The travel key value corresponding to the destination of the travel. For example, '11 AY'.

200.description: This section describes the 200 status response for this operation. The response contains the collection of activity travel statistics. If any of the listed request parameters are not specified, all the available records are returned.

default.description: This section describes the default error response for this operation.

patch.description:
This operation updates the travel duration override for the travel keys that are currently active. However, it is possible to override the travel durations only at the company level and not at any of the lower levels.

The override value is stored in the system in addition to the statistically learned value. For travel duration estimates, if an override is specified, then the override value is used instead of the statistically learned value. However, the statistically learned value is kept updated based on new reported durations. At any point of time, it is possible to stop using the overrides by importing the data again with value 0 in the 'override' field. In such cases, the system starts using the statistically learned value for duration estimates.

Note:

  • When the Statistics API is used to make travel duration changes, the changes are reflected for all future travels in the application only after the next run of the statistics agent. The statistics agent is run once a day, usually in the early morning hours.
  • The limit for each API request is 10000 records. To update more records, multiple requests can be used.

    • The following error messages are supported for the HTTP Code 400 response on this operation:

    • Maximum number of resource data exceeded. Limit 10000
    • Invalid structure. Items tag missing
    • Invalid structure. <fkey|tkey|override> tag missing
    • Property <fkey|tkey|override> value not set
    • Property override value should not be negative
    • Property override value should not be greater than 480
    • Property <fkey|tkey> value length should not exceed 50

    This operation can be used only when the following conditions are satisfied:

    • The customer must have a subscription to Oracle Field Service Professional or Enterprise Cloud Service.
    • The required application must have permission to access the Statistics API. To grant the permission, navigate to Configuration, Applications screen. For the required application, click Add new in the API access section, and select Statistics API.

name.title: Name
name.description:
The translation for the name of the activity type.

If the language parameter is specified, then the name is provided in that language.

If the language parameter is not specified, then the name is provided in English, unless the request is performed using an OFSC user account which is linked to an API application (in this case, the name is provided in the language of the user making the request).

resourcesToAllow.description: The resourceInternalIds and resourceIds (external IDs) of resources accessible to the application. The parameter includes all the children of a specified resource. If the resourceInternalIds and resourceIds (external IDs) of resources are not specified, then the parameter allows the application to access the root resource. If both resourceId and resourceInternalId are used in the request parameter, then the application considers the resourceID (unless it is empty).

allowedCorsDomains.description: The list of origin domains which are allowed to send requests to OFSC REST API. The max size of a value is 1020 symbols or 100 domain entries.

parent.title: Parent
parent.description:
The details of the parent capacity area.

The Parent value is returned, if the value is specified in the Expand parameter. The value is not returned when:

  • The capacity area or capacity area group is located at the top level of the hierarchy.
  • The value is not visible for the current user.

CapacityAreaConfiguration.description: The schema of the capacity area object.

label.description: The label of the capacity area.

name.description: The name of the capacity area in the user's language.

parentLabel.description: The label of the parent group.

status.description: The status of the capacity area.

configuration.description: The configuration of the capacity area.

definitionLevel.description: The definition level set for the quota.

byDay.description:
The configuration defined for the capacity area determines how quota is entered for a day.
  • minutes: Indicates that the quota is entered in minutes
  • percentIncludeOtherActivities: Indicates that the quota is entered as a percentage of the maximum available capacity according to the calendar. The maximum available capacity considers the capacity of the 'Other' activities.
  • percentExcludeOtherActivities: Indicates that the quota is entered as a percentage of the maximum available capacity according to the calendar. The maximum available capacity considers the capacity of the 'Other' activities.

byCapacityCategory.description:
The configuration defined for the capacity area determines how quota is entered for the capacity category.
  • minutes: Indicates that the quota is entered in minutes.
  • percentOfMaxAvailable: Indicates that the quota is entered as a percentage of the maximum available capacity.
  • percentQuotaParentLevel: Indicates that the quota is entered as a percentage of the quota defined on the parent level.

byTimeSlot.description:
The configuration defined for the capacity area determines how quota is entered for a timeslot.
  • minutes: Indicates that the quota is entered in minutes
  • percentOfAvailable: Indicates that the quota is entered as a percentage of the maximum available capacity according to the calendar.
  • percentExcludeOtherActivities: Indicates that the quota is entered as a percentage of the maximum available capacity according to the calendar. The maximum available capacity considers the capacity of the 'Other' activities.
  • percentQuotaParentLevel: Indicates that the quota is entered as a percentage of the quota defined on the parent level.

isTimeSlotBase.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the time slot based quota is available for the capacity area. If false, then only the time interval based quota is available for the capacity area. The default value is false.

isAllowCloseOnWorkzoneLevel.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the quota is closed for the workzone. If false, then the quota is open for the workzone. The default value is false.

capacityCategories.description: The capacity categories assigned to the capacity area. The capacity categories are not retrieved for a capacity area group.

href.description: The link to the capacity category collection.

timeSlots.description: The time slots assigned to the capacity area. The time slots are not retrieved for a capacity area group.

href.description: The link to the time slot collection.

workZones.description: The work zones assigned to the capacity area. The work zones are not retrieved for a capacity area group.

href.description: The link to the work zone collection.

timeIntervals.description: The time intervals assigned to the capacity area. The time intervals are not retrieved for a capacity area group.

href.description: The link to the time interval collection.

organizations.description: The organizations assigned to the capacity area. The organizations are not retrieved for a capacity area group.

href.description: The link to the organization collection.

children.description: The capacity areas assigned to the capacity area group. The child capacity areas are always returned for a capacity area group.

workSkills.description: The array of work skill objects. It is optional for the PUT operation.

workSkillGroups.description: The array of work skill group objects. It is optional for the PUT operation.

timeSlots.title: Time Slots
timeSlots.description: The array of time slots objects. It is optional for the PUT operation.

translations.title: Translations
translations.description:
The list of translations associated with the name of the capacity category.
  • The translations parameter is required in the PUT method for creating a capacity category, but the parameter is optional for updating a capacity category.
  • If the parameter is not specified, then the translations in the response are not changed.
  • The translation for the 'name' attribute must not be empty atleast for the default language.

Forms.title: Forms
Forms.description: The collection of forms. It is not returned for an empty collection.

hasMore.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then there are more results that can be retrieved with successive paging requests.

If false or if the value is not present, then there are no more results or this is the final page. The default value is true.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: The offset value specified in the request.

limit.title: Limit

Form.title: Form
Form.description: The form entity in the Oracle Field Service Cloud application.

label.title: Label
label.description: The label of the form.

name.title: Name

translations.description: The list of associated translations that is returned for the name of the form. The list is only returned if the language parameter is not specified in the request.

FormContent.description: The specified form content in JSON string format.

content.description: The JSON string that describes the form content.

FormDetailsWithStats.description: The list of errors and warnings that occured while creating or updating the form.

warnings.title: Warnings
warnings.description: The list of warnings that occurred while saving the form.

FormBody.description: The schema of the request body object for this operation.

translations.title: Translations
translations.description:
The list of translations associated with the name of the form. The list is only returned if the language parameter is not specified in the request.
  • The translations parameter is required for creating a form, but the parameter is optional for updating a form.
  • If the parameter is not specified, then the translations in the response are not changed.
  • If the parameter is present in the request, then the 'name' attribute is required for English and the attribute cannot be empty.
  • All the translations for the name of the form are replaced in the request.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the form.

totalResults.description: The total number of the inventory type records in the collection.

Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then there are more results that can be retrieved with successive paging requests.

If false or if the value is not present, then there are no more results or this is the final page. The default value is true.

limit.description: The limit value specified in the request. If the value is not specified in the request or if the specified value is not accepted, then it defaults to 100.

The translation for the name of the inventory type.

If the value of the language parameter is specified, then the name is provided in the specified language. If the value is not specified, then the name is provided in English, unless the request is performed using an OFSC user account which is linked to an API application (in this case the name is provided in the language of the user making the request).

unitOfMeasurement.title: Unit Of Measurement
unitOfMeasurement.description:
The translation for the unit of measurement of the inventory type.

If the value of the language parameter is specified, then the unit of measurement is provided the specified language. If the value is not specified, then the unit of measurement is provided in English, unless the request is performed using an OFSC user account which is linked to an API application (in this case the unit of measurement is provided in the language of the user making the request).

This field is present for non-serialized inventory types only.

active.title: Active
active.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then the inventory type is listed as a possible value in the 'Inventory Type' drop-down list in Manage or Mobility apps while creating an inventory. If false, then the inventory type is not listed as a value in the drop-down list. The default value is true.

nonSerialized.title: Non Serialized
nonSerialized.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the inventory is serialized, that is, it has a serial number. If false, then the inventory is non-serialized, that is, it does not have a serial number.

modelProperty.title: Model Property
modelProperty.description: Label of an inventory property which is used to identify model of this inventory

translations.title: Translations
translations.description: The list of translations associated with the name and unit of measurement of the inventory type. The list is only returned if the language parameter is not specified in request.

totalResults.description: The total number of language records in the collection.

offset.description: The offset value specified in the request.

limit.description: The limit value specified in the request. If the value is not specified in the request or if the specified value is not accepted, then it defaults to 100.

label.title: Label
label.description: The unique label assigned to the language code. For example, en.

name.title: Name
name.description:
The translation for the language name. If the language parameter is specified, then the name is provided in that language.

If the language parameter is not specified, then the name is provided in English, unless the request is performed using an Oracle Field Service Cloud user account which is linked to an API application (in this case, the name is provided in the language of the user making the request).

active.title: Active
active.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.
  • If true, then the activity type is listed as a possible value in the 'Activity Type' drop-down list in the Manage or Mobility apps while creating an activity.
  • If false, then the activity type is not listed as a value in the drop-down list.

The default value is true.

CustomMapLayers.title: Custom Map Layers
CustomMapLayers.description: The collection of custom map layers.

items.description: An array of custom map layers. The array is not returned if the collection is empty.

totalResults.description: The total number of items in the collection.

offset.description: The index from which the custom map layers are retrieved.

limit.description: The maximum number of custom map layers retrieved.

label.title: Label
label.description: The unique identifier of the custom map layer.

type.title: Type
type.description:
The type of the custom map layer. The value can be set to either 'external' or 'internal'.

  • If the value is set to 'external', then the geo data is imported from external source.
  • If the value is set to 'internal', then the geo data is in the Oracle Field Service Cloud MapViewer, and it need not be imported.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the custom map layers. The status can be set to either 'active' or 'inactive'.

sourceName.title: Source Name
sourceName.description: The name of the external source of the custom map layers. This field is not applicable for the internal custom map layers.

theme.title: Theme
theme.description: The theme name of the external custom map layers. This field is not applicable for the internal custom map layers.

url.title: URL
url.description: The URL for the external custom map layers. This field is not applicable for the internal custom map layers.

text.title: Text
text.description: The name of the custom map layer in the user's language. This field is returned only by using the GET operation and it is ignored in a PUT or POST operation.

translations.title: Translations
translations.description: The translations of all the custom map layers. This field is required in a PUT or POST operation. The translation of the 'text' parameter is required for the default language.

shapeTitleColumn.title: Shape Title Column
shapeTitleColumn.description: The name of the column that is selected as the title. This field is returned only if the property is set for the custom map layer.

CustomActionMapLayersPopulateLayersSchem.title: Populate Layers Response
CustomActionMapLayersPopulateLayersSchem.description: The schema of the response body object for this operation.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the downloaded shape file.

time.title: Time
time.description: The time when the operation started.

downloadId.title: Download ID
downloadId.description: The identifier of the shape file specified in the request.

CustomActionMapLayersPopulateLayersSchem.title: Populate Layers Request
CustomActionMapLayersPopulateLayersSchem.description: The schema of the request body object for this operation.

URL.title: URL
URL.description: The URL of the external source from which the geo-data is downloaded.

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description:
The authentication used for downloading the geo-data from the external source specified in the URL field.

  • If the URL points to an HTTP service, and the type of the authentication specified is 'basic', then Oracle Field Service Cloud sends a request to this URL to authenticate using the HTTP-Basic scheme with the username and password as credentials.
  • If the URL points to an FTP service, and the type of the authentication specified is 'ftp', then Oracle Field Service Cloud connects via the FTP protocol using the username and password as credentials.
  • If the type of the authentication specified is 'none', then Oracle Field Service Cloud downloads the geo-data without any authentication.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the authentication. The allowed values are 'none', 'basic', and 'ftp'.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username used to authenticate the connection between Oracle Field Service Cloud and the external source.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password used to authenticate the connection between Oracle Field Service Cloud and the external source.

shapeTitleColumn.title: Shape Title Column
shapeTitleColumn.description: The name of the non-spatial column that contains the titles of the shapes that are displayed on the map.

shapeHintColumns.title: Shape Hint Columns
shapeHintColumns.description: The set of objects that define the contents of the hint for the shapes on the map.

sourceColumn.title: Source Column Name
sourceColumn.description: The unique name of the source column in the user's language. The name specified in this parameter is displayed as a hint.

defaultName.title: Default Column Name
defaultName.description: The unique name of the shapefile column.

layerLabel.title: Layer Label
layerLabel.description: The unique identifier of the layer.

SRID.title: SRID
SRID.description: The spatial reference identifier (SRID) of the geo-data in the shape file.

totalResults.description: The total number of the non-working reason records in the collection.

hasMore.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then there are more results that can be retrieved with successive paging requests.

If false or if the value is not present, then there are no more results or this is the final page. The default value is true.

offset.description: The offset value specified in the request.

limit.description: The limit value specified in the request. If the value is not specified in the request or if the specified value is not accepted, then it defaults to 100.

label.title: Label
label.description: The unique label assigned to the non-working reason. For example, Illness.

name.title: Name
name.description:
The translation for the name of the non-working reason.

If the value of language parameter is specified, then the name is provided in the specified language.

If the value is not specified, then the name is provided in English, unless the request is performed using an OFSC user account which is linked to an API application (in this case the name is provided in the language of the user making the request).

active.title: Active
active.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then the non-working reason is listed as a possible value in the 'Non-working Reason' drop-down list in Manage or Mobility apps while creating an activity. If false, then the value is not listed in the drop-down list. The default value is true.

translations.title: Translations
translations.description: The list of translations associated with the name of the non-working reason. The list is only returned if the language parameter is not specified in request.

totalResults.description: The total number of organizations retrieved.

totalResults.description: The number of properties returned in the response.

offset.description: The offset value specified in the request.

limit.description: The limit value specified in the request.

label.title: Label
label.description:
The label of the property. It is the unique identifier of the property in Oracle Field Service Cloud.

This field is present for all the types of properties. The label cannot be changed for an existing property.

name.title: Name
name.description:
The name of the property in user's language.

This field is present for all types of properties. It is returned only by using a GET operation and is ignored in PUT and PATCH operations.

hint.title: Hint
hint.description:
The hint of the property name in the user's language.

This field is present for all the types of properties. It is returned only by using a GET operation and is ignored in PUT and PATCH operations.

type.title: Type
type.description:
The type of the property.

This field is present for all the property types. It is required in a PUT operation and is optional in a PATCH operation. The property type cannot be changed for an existing property.

entity.title: Entity
entity.description:
The entity of the property.

This field is present for all property types. It is required in a PUT operation and is optional in a PATCH operation. This field cannot be changed for an existing property.

gui.title: GUI
gui.description:
The GUI of the property. It defines how the property is displayed to the users.

This field is present for all property types. It is required in a PUT operation and optional in a PATCH operation. It cannot be changed for a property of type 'field'.

cloneFlag.title: Clone Flag
cloneFlag.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the property is duplicated while reopening an activity or applying pre-work for a new activity. If false, then you cannot duplicate the property.

This field is optional and present for all the property types except 'field'. It is not set for the entity 'resource'.

template.title: Template
template.description: The template of the property. This field is optional and is present only for the properties of type 'integer' and 'string'.

lines.title: Lines
lines.description:
The number of lines that the property displays in the Activity Details form.

This field is optional and is present only for the properties of type 'string'. The value can be set only to 1 for all GUI elements except for the 'text' element.

fileSizeLimit.title: File Size Limit
fileSizeLimit.description:
The maximum file size allowed for 'file' elements. The default and the maximum size allowed is 5 MB.

This field is optional and is present only for the file properties with the GUI file element.

mimeTypes.title: Mime Types
mimeTypes.description:
An array of MIME types. This is an optional field and is present only for properties of type 'file'.

This field is required in a PUT operation and is optional in a PATCH operation. It is ignored for a property with the gui 'image'.

maxWidth.title: Max Width
maxWidth.description: The maximum width of the property. This field is optional and is present only for the file properties with the GUI image element.

maxHeight.title: Max Height
maxHeight.description: The maximum height of the property. This field is optional and is present only for the file properties with the GUI image element.

allowDraw.title: Allow Draw
allowDraw.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the user can draw on the captured image using a stylus. If false, then the user cannot draw on the captured image using a stylus.

This field is optional and is present only for the file properties that have the GUI Image element.

getGeolocation.title: Get Geolocation
getGeolocation.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the location information is saved on the map. If false, then the location information is not saved on the map.

This field is optional and is present only for the file properties with the GUI image element.

regExpLines.description: The array of Perl Compatible Regular Expression (PCRE) lines. Each line contains a regular expression rule in the format: <match criteria> = <replace>. For example, the following line copies the entire text: /^.*$/m = $0. Lines in the array are applied to the source text successively.

xslt.description: The XSLT document used to transform the source text (after processing with regExpLines) to display the property value.

transformation.title: Transformation
transformation.description: The array of transformation objects. This field is optional and is present only for the properties of type 'string' with the gui 'text'.

translations.title: Translations
translations.description:
The list of associated translations returned for the name the property. The list is returned only if the language parameter is not specified in request.

This field is present for all the property types. It is required in a PUT operation and optional in a PATCH operation. For the default language, specify the value of the 'name' parameter.

PropertyEnumerations.description: The collection of enumeration values of a property.

items.description:
An array of enumeration values.

Note: At least one item in the array should be active.

totalResults.description: The total number of enumeration values retrieved.

offset.description: The offset value specified in the request.

limit.description: The limit value specified in the request.

label.description: The code of the enumeration item. This code is unique only to the specified property. The values '0' and '-1' are reserved for internal purposes and cannot be used. The values cannot be changed or deleted.

active.title: Active
active.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the enumeration item is active. If false, then then the enumeration item is inactive.

translations.title: Translations
translations.description: An array containing the translations of the enumeration item in different languages.

totalResults.description: The total number of the resource type records in the collection.

If true, then there are more results that can be retrieved with successive paging requests.

If false or the value is not present, then there are no more results or this is the final page. The default value is true.

offset.description: The offset value specified in the request.

limit.description: The limit value specified in the request. If the value is not specified in the request or if the specified value is not accepted, then it defaults to 100.

label.title: Label
label.description: The unique label assigned to the resource type. For example,  GR (Group).

name.title: Name
name.description:
The translation for the name of the resource type.

If the language parameter is specified, then the name is provided in that language.

If the language parameter is not specified, then the name is provided in English, unless the request is performed using an OFSC user account which is linked to an API application (in this case, the name is provided in the language of the user making the request).

active.title: Active
active.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then the resource type is listed as a possible value in the 'Resource Type' drop-down list in Manage or Mobility apps while creating a resource. If false, then the resource type is not listed as a value in the drop-down list. The default value is true.

role.title: Role
role.description: The role of the resource type.

translations.title: Translations
translations.description: The list of translations associated with the name of the resource type. The list is only returned if the language parameter is not specified in request.

TimeSlots.description: The collection of time slots. It is not returned for an empty collection.

totalResults.description: The total number of the time slots records in the collection.

hasMore.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then there are more results that can be retrieved with successive paging requests.

If false or if the value is not present, then there are no more results or this is the final page. The default value is true.

offset.description: The offset value specified in the request.

limit.description: The limit value specified in the request. If the value is not specified in the request or if the specified value is not accepted, then it defaults to 100.

label.title: Label
label.description: The unique label assigned to the time slot.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the time slot. For example, 8-10.

active.title: Active
active.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then the time slot is listed as an option in the Time slot drop-down list in the Oracle Field Service Cloud (OFSC) application. If false, then the time slot is not listed as an option in the drop-down list. The default value is true.

isAllDay.title: Is All Day
isAllDay.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the activities with the 'allDay' time slot can be performed at any time during the day. If false, then the activities cannot be performed at any time during the day. The default value is false.

timeStart.title: Time Start
timeStart.description: The time when the time slot starts. For example, 14:00 hours.

timeEnd.title: Time End
timeEnd.description: The time when the time slot ends. For example, 16:00 hours.

WorkSkillConditions.description: The collection of work skill conditions.

totalResults.description: The total number of work skill conditions returned.

internalId.title: Internal ID
internalId.description: The identifier of the work skill condition in Oracle Field Service Cloud. This ID is used for internal reference only.

label.title: Label
label.description: The label of the work skill condition. This field is required for all conditions. The label cannot be changed for an existing condition.

requiredLevel.title: Required Level
requiredLevel.description: The work skill level required for a condition. This field is required for all conditions.

preferableLevel.title: Preferable Level
preferableLevel.description: The preference level of a work skill condition. This field is required for all conditions.

label.description: The label of the condition object.

function.description: The function used by the condition to test a property.

value.description: The value used by the condition to test a function. This value is ignored for 'isNull' and 'isNotNull' functions, as they do not require parameters. It is also ignored for 'in' and 'notIn' functions, as they require list of parameters.

valueList.description:
The array of values used by the condition to test a function. This field is used for testing 'in' and 'notIn' functions.

A list of strings can be used to test string fields. A list of enumeration labels can be used to test enumeration fields.

dependency.description: The array of objects containing the internal ID fields.

internalId.description: The internal ID of the dependency object.

assignToResource.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then the work skill group is assigned to the resource. By default, it is true.

Note: This field is present for all work skill groups.

addToCapacityCategory.title: Add to Capacity Category
addToCapacityCategory.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then the work skill group is added to the capacity category. By default, it is true.

Note: This field is present for all work skill groups.

active.title: Active
active.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then the work skill group is active. If false, then the work skill group is inactive. By default, it is true.

Note: It is present for all work skill groups.

label.description: The label of the work skill object.

ratio.description: The ratio used to assign the work skill group to a resource.

workSkills.title: Work Skills
workSkills.description: The array of work skill objects associated with the work skill group.

items.description: The collection of work skills. It is not returned for an empty collection.

totalResults.description: The total number of the non-working reason records in the collection.

hasMore.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then there are more results that can be retrieved with successive paging requests.

If false or if the value is not present, then there are no more results or this is the final page. The default value is true.

offset.description: The offset value specified in the request.

limit.description: The limit value specified in the request. If the value is not specified in the request or if the specified value is not accepted, then it defaults to 100.

label.title: Label
label.description: The label of the work skill specified in the request.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the work skill in user's language.

active.title: Active
active.description:
Contains one of the following values: true or false.

If true, then the work skill is active. If false, then the work skill is inactive. By default, it is true.

sharing.title: Sharing
sharing.description:
The sharing option defined for work skills in the team.

The allowed values are as follows:

  • Maximal: The team gets the maximum work skill level of all team members. This is the default value.
  • Minimal: The team gets the minimal work skill level of all team members.
  • No sharing: The team does not get the work skill of a team member.
  • Summary: The team gets the total sum of work skill levels of all the team members.

translations.title: Translations
translations.description: The list of translations associated with the name of the work skill.

items.description: An array of work zone items.

totalResults.description: The total number of work zones retrieved.

customActionWorkZonesPopulateShapesSchem.description: The request body parameters for populating shapes. These parameters are used to download and convert shapes.

workZoneKeyElement.description: The element of the work zone key composite.

language.description:
The language code of the translated text. The code in the response is two characters long (for example, 'en', 'es').

See Supported Language Codes to view the values that are supported.

StartChatRequest.description: The schema of the request body object for this operation.

name.description: The name of the participant.

present.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the participant is present in the chat. If false, then then the participant is not present in the chat.

online.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the participant is online. If false, then then the participant is not online.

invitedBy.description: The login of the user who invited the participant to the chat or conference. This field is present only for the chats started by a user.

invitedTime.description: The time (in UTC time zone) when the participant was invited to a chat or conference. The time is specified in 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' format.

leftTime.description: The time (in UTC time zone) when the participant left the chat. The time is specified in 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' format.

chatId.description: The unique identifier of the chat in Oracle Field Service Cloud.

type.description:
The type of the chat. The possible values of this field are:

  • normal - A chat between two participants
  • conference - A chat with more than two participants

startedTime.description: The time (in UTC time zone) when the chat started. The time is in 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' format.

startedBy.description: The login of the user who started the chat. This field is present only for the chats started by a user.

participants.description: Link to participant of the chat

StartChatResponse.description: The details of the new chat.

activities.title: Activities

items.description: The list of activities retrieved based on the search criteria.
items.title: Items

totalResults.description: The total number of activity records in the response.
totalResults.title: Total Results

offset.description: The offset value specified in the request.
offset.title: Offset

limit.description: The limit value specified in the request. If the value is not specified in the request or if the specified value is not accepted, then it defaults to 100.
limit.title: Limit

activities.description: The collection of activities retrieved based on the search criteria.

customerEmail.description: The email address of the customer.
customerEmail.title: Customer Email

timeZone.description:
The name of the customer's time zone. For example, Eastern.

By default, the time zone of the resource (to which the activity is assigned) is used.

For a list of supported time zones, see Supported Time Zones.
timeZone.title: Time Zone

timeZoneIANA.title: Time Zone IANA name
timeZoneIANA.description: The IANA name of the time zone. (https://www.iana.org/time-zones). For example, America/New_York. This field is read-only, but when creating or updating an activity, the field 'timeZone' accepts both IANA names and Oracle Field Service Cloud specific names.

resourceTimeZone.title: Resource Time Zone
resourceTimeZone.description: The time zone of the resource to which this activity is assigned (for example, Eastern). This is a read-only field and may change when the activity is reassigned to another resource.

resourceTimeZoneIANA.title: Resource Time Zone IANA name
resourceTimeZoneIANA.description: The IANA name of the resource's time zone (For example, America/New_York). This field is read-only and may change when the activity is reassigned to another resource.

resourceTimeZoneDiff.title: Resource Time Zone Diff
resourceTimeZoneDiff.description: The difference between UTC and the resource's local time, displayed in minutes. For example, -180 means that the resource time is 3 hours behind UTC. This field is read-only and may change when the activity is reassigned to another resource.

date.description: The date on which the activity is scheduled. This field is not present in the response, if the activity is not scheduled for any particular date.
date.title: Date

startTime.description: The estimated time of arrival for the activities in 'pending' status and the actual start time for the activities in 'started' and 'completed' status. The time is displayed in 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' format in the time zone of the resource to which the activity is assigned.
startTime.title: Start Time

endTime.description: The predicted or the actual end time of the activity. The time is displayed in the time zone of the resource to which the activity is assigned and is in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format.
endTime.title: End Time

firstManualOperation.description: The name of the first manual operation on the activity.
firstManualOperation.title: First Manual Operation

teamResourceId.description: The identifier of the team resource for a teamwork activity.
teamResourceId.title: Team Resource ID

workZone.description: The work zone in which the activity occurs. It is a read-only field that is automatically assigned to an activity, based on the company setting 'work zone key' and the activity properties. For example, if 'work zone key' is the first 4 symbols of the 'city' field, then the activity with city=Belfast will have a work zone assigned which has 'BELF' as one of its keys.
workZone.title: Work Zone

travelTime.description: The estimated time taken to travel to this activity. The estimate is based on the previous activity in route.
travelTime.title: Travel Time

deliveryWindowStart.description: The time when the activity delivery window starts. The time is displayed in the time zone of the resource to which the activity is assigned and is in HH:MM:SS format.
deliveryWindowStart.title: Delivery Window Start

city.description: The city of the customer where the activity is scheduled.
city.title: City

timeOfBooking.description: The time when the customer booked the activity. The time is displayed in the time zone of the customer.
timeOfBooking.title: Time Of Booking

stateProvince.description: The state or province of the customer. This field is used for geocoding and must contain a valid address.
stateProvince.title: State Province

streetAddress.description: The street address of the customer. This field is used for geocoding and must contain a valid address.
streetAddress.title: Street Address

longitude.description: The geographic coordinates that specify the location of the activity.
longitude.title: Longitude

timeOfAssignment.description: The time when the activity is assigned to the technician. This time is displayed in the time zone of the resource to which the activity is assigned.
timeOfAssignment.title: Time Of Assignment

points.description: The cost of the activity in 'points'. This field is intended for use by the Routing module.
points.title: Points

timeDeliveredStart.description: The start time of the technician's arrival interval as communicated to the customer. This time is displayed in the time zone of the resource to which the activity is assigned.
timeDeliveredStart.title: Time Delivered Start

resourceId.description:
The identifier of the resource to which this activity is assigned. This field is not returned if the resource ID is empty.

Note: Do not use empty strings in requests.
resourceId.title: Resource ID

reminderTime.description: The number of minutes before the activity start time the customer must be notified of the activity.
reminderTime.title: Reminder Time

country_code.description: The code of the country where the activity is scheduled.
country_code.title: Country Code

activityType.description:
The type of the activity specified in the request. Based on the activity type, predefined company-specific rules are applied while processing an activity. Predefined company-specific rules cover the following:
  • The resources to which the activity is assigned.
  • The activity processing details.
  • The interaction of the activity with different modules of Oracle Field Service Cloud.
activityType.title: Activity Type

apptNumber.description: This field may be used by integrations to store the identifier of the activity in the origin system. This field has no business significance in Oracle Field Service Cloud and can be left empty.
apptNumber.title: Appt Number

masterActivityId.description: The identifier of a segmentable activity. It is available for individual segments which have the record type set to 'multiday_activity_segment'. This field is not set for regular activities.
masterActivityId.title: Master Activity ID

deliveryWindowEnd.description: The time when the activity delivery window ends. The time is displayed in the time zone of the resource to which the activity is assigned and is in HH:MM:SS format.
deliveryWindowEnd.title: Delivery Window End

status.description:
The status of the activity. As a technician works through the activity, the status changes. The actions that are available for an activity are based on this status.

A newly created activity has the status as 'pending', but it can then be changed to 'cancelled' or 'started'. The status of an activity can be changed to 'complete', 'notdone', or 'suspended' only if it has the status as 'started'.
status.title: Status

language.description: The preferred language of the customer. By default, the language that is set for the Login screen is used. The following language codes are accepted: Supported Language Codes.
language.title: Language

positionInRoute.description: The position of the activity in the route. For not-ordered activities, this field is not present in the response. For ordered activities, a 1-based number is returned.
positionInRoute.title: Position In Route

postalCode.description: The postal code of the customer. This field is used for geocoding and must contain a valid address.
postalCode.title: Postal Code

timeDeliveredEnd.description: The end time of the technician's arrival interval as communicated to the customer. This time is displayed in the time zone of the resource to which the activity is assigned.
timeDeliveredEnd.title: Time Delivered End

timeSlot.description: The time slot during which the activity is completed. The time slot also indicates the service window for the activity.
timeSlot.title: Time Slot

latitude.description: The geographic coordinates that specify the location of the activity.
latitude.title: Latitude

recordType.description:
The type of the activity record. The following values are allowed:
  • regular - this is the default record type for most new activities.
  • prework - this type of record is created if a technician has to perform some work before the actual activity starts.
  • reopened - a record of this type is created when an activity is reopened for some reason.
  • multiday_activity - this record type is created when the 'activityType' indicates that this is a segmentable activity.
  • multiday_activity_segment - Number of records of this type are created for segmentable activities, based on their duration and time slot settings.
recordType.title: Record Type

customerCell.description: The cell phone number of the customer. From version 17.2.1, the phone number is saved in OFSC with the '+' symbol. For example, if you enter the phone number as +1(234)234-23_42, it is saved in OFSC as +12342342342. In versions before 17.2.1, the phone number is saved as 12342342342.

streetAddress.description: The street address of the customer. This field is used for geocoding and must contain a valid address.

timeOfAssignment.description: The time when the activity is assigned to the technician. This time is displayed in the time zone of the resource to which the activity is assigned.

points.description: The cost of the activity in 'points'. This parameter is intended for use by the Routing module.

activityType.description:
The type of the activity. Based on the activity type, predefined company-specific rules are applied while processing an activity. Predefined company-specific rules cover the following:

  • The resources to which the activities can be assigned.
  • The activity processing details.
  • The interaction of the activity with different modules of Oracle Field Service Cloud.
activityType.title: Activity Type

apptNumber.description: This field may be used by integrations to store the identifier of the activity in the origin system. This field has no business significance in Oracle Field Service Cloud and may be left empty.
apptNumber.title: Appt Number

status.description:
The status of the activity. As a technician works through the activity, the status changes. The actions that are available for an activity are based on this status.

A newly created activity has the status as 'pending', it can then be changed to 'cancelled' or 'started'. The status of an activity can be changed to 'complete', 'notdone', or 'suspended' only if it has the status as 'started'.
status.title: Status

language.description:
The preferred language of the customer. This parameter is optional and its value defaults to the language set for the Login screen.

The accepted language codes are listed on: Supported Language Codes.
language.title: Language

postalCode.description: The postal code of the customer. This field is used for geocoding and must contain a valid address.
postalCode.title: Postal Code

timeSlot.description: The time slot during which the activity is completed. Time Slot also indicates the service window for the activity. This time is displayed in the time zone of the resource to which the activity is assigned.
timeSlot.title: Time Slot

latitude.description: The geographic coordinates that specify the location of the activity.
latitude.title: Latitude

customerCell.description: The customer's cell phone number. From version 17.2.1, the phone number is saved in OFSC with the '+' symbol. For example, if you enter the phone number as +1(234)234-23_42, it is saved in OFSC as +12342342342. In versions before 17.2.1, the phone number is saved as 12342342342.
customerCell.title: Customer Cell

customerNumber.description: The account number of the customer. This parameter is used by integrations as a placeholder for the external identifier of the Account ID in the application. This parameter has no business significance in Oracle Field Service Cloud and can be left empty.
customerNumber.title: Customer Number

multidayTimeToComplete.description: The total duration of the segmentable activity. Specify the time in 'HH:MM:SS' format.
multidayTimeToComplete.title: Segmentable Activity Duration

multidayActivityStatus.description: The status of the segmentable activity.
multidayActivityStatus.title: Segmentable Activity Status

customerPhone.description: The regular (land) phone number of the customer. From version 17.2.1, the phone number is saved in OFSC with the '+' symbol. For example, if you enter the phone number as +1(234)234-23_42, it is saved in OFSC as +12342342342. In versions before 17.2.1, the phone number is saved as 12342342342.
customerPhone.title: Customer Phone
